metadata without the need for Observables

Issues.Title: it would be nice to have a way to automatically show methods and properties that are deprecated
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description Currently, if a property or method is deprecated, a code owner or doc author must explicitly state that in the description text for that property or method. There is no automated way to have these presented in the AIO docs with strikethrough and a standard "Deprecated in version x" statement. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction See https://next.angular.io/api/forms/ReactiveFormsModule#withconfig There is no indication in the AIO docs that this is deprecated. Now click `< >` to see the source code, where the deprecation is mentioned: ``` static withConfig(opts: { /** @deprecated as of v6 */ warnOnNgModelWithFormControl: 'never' | 'once' | 'always' }): ModuleWithProviders { return { ngModule: ReactiveFormsModule, providers: [{ provide: NG_MODEL_WITH_FORM_CONTROL_WARNING, useValue: opts.warnOnNgModelWithFormControl }] }; ``` ### What's the affected URL?** See above. Also see https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30098 for more examples. ### Reproduction Steps** See above ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** Readers expect AIO to clearly identify these properties and methods as deprecated, without having to open the source code to read the comments. ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant? Related Issues: Deprecate `ReactiveFormsModule.withConfig` method https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/22640 docs: add deprecation info for properties, methods, etc. to deprecations summary doc https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30098
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "it would be nice to have a way to automatically show methods and properties that are deprecated" (#30408)

Issues.Title: docs - cli: change ng analytics to have link to stable instead of next
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description The command help and reference page for `ng update` contains a hard-coded reference to `next.angular.io`: https://next.angular.io/cli/analytics "Configures the gathering of Angular CLI usage metrics. See https://next.angular.io/cli/usage-analytics-gathering." That reference needs to be changed **before the final RC build of the CLI** so that the cli help and the AIO command reference page go to `https:/angular.io/cli/usage-analytics-gathering`. **It's also possible that the cli itself has a link to `https://next.angular.io/analytics`, which will need to be changed to `https://angular.io/analytics`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** See above ### Reproduction Steps** See above ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** See above ## üì∑Screenshot n/a ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: docs: Ivy programmatic usage
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description One of the key selling points of the new Ivy render is locality and that it make it easier to use for build tooling. I know this might be early, but the documentation could really use a (simple) example showing how to use the compiler from a JS context. Some examples of what I mean can be found in other tooling: * LESS: http://lesscss.org/usage/#programmatic-usage * SASS: https://sass-lang.com/documentation/js-api * TypeScript: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/Using-the-Compiler-API * UglifyJs: https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS2#api-reference Angular could really benefit from something like this. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** ### Reproduction Steps** ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: build(docs-infra): ensure hidden cli commands are excluded from `sitemap.xml`
Issues.Body:
Previously, the processor that excludes certain cli commands (`filterHiddenCommand`) was being run after the `createSitemap` processor, resulting in those commands to be present in `sitemap.xml`, while the actual pages where missing. This also resulted in 404s, when search engine crawlers tried to index the missing URLs.

This commit fixes it by ensuring that the `filterHiddenCommand` processor is run before the `createSitemap` processor.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build(docs-infra): ensure hidden cli commands are excluded from `sitemap.xml`" (#30395)

Issues.Title: API reference: filter to include the APIs that I should use
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description Currently, the API reference can be filtered by: * All * Deprecated * Security Risk What I'm most likely to want is this: All the APIs that I **should** use. It would be nice to have a filter that excludes deprecated and security risks. It might be nice to have that be the default, to help encourage use of non-deprecated and secure APIs. Name ideas: "Current" or "Recommended" or "Stable"? * Stable * Deprecated * Security Risk * All If "Experimental" or "Labs" is ever added, this new option would also exclude those, to focus readers on the most stable APIs. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction See above ### What's the affected URL?** `https://angular.io/api` ### Reproduction Steps** See above ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** See above ## üì∑Screenshot n/a ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Body: This PR fixes an issue where IE 11 can return `undefined` in with an `Object.keys` call. Solution is to add a runtime check on the value. Issues.Title: Order of parameters not preserved when using x-prompt
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [X] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [X] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description When Angular CLI is asking for parameters specified with x-prompt in a schematics, the order should be preserved. This seems to be true for small number of prompts, but breaks when more are used. The likely culprit is the sort on top of _applyPrompts in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/core/src/json/schema/registry.ts It seems that older V8 versions didn't implement stable sort. I don't follow exactly the Node releases, so it's possible this is fixed in the absolutely newest one. Seeing that the priorities are currently not configurable, maybe commenting-out the sort call is the quickest fix. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - define schema.json with larger number of parameters and x-prompt (our is currently using 13) - run ng new or ng generate without providing the parameters, thus triggering the interactive prompts ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 7.3.8
Node: 10.15.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.13.8
@angular-devkit/core         7.3.8
@angular-devkit/schematics   7.3.8
@schematics/angular          7.3.8
@schematics/update           0.13.8
rxjs                         6.3.3
typescript                   3.2.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Order of parameters not preserved when using x-prompt" (#14402)

### Is this a regression?

When a loadChildren callback uses a dynamic import to bring in a lazy loaded module from a barrel file, the path gets changed to `./path-to-barrel.ngfactory` in AoT. Which does not work.

loadChildren: import('./shared').then(mod => mod.LazyModule)
```

Issues.Title: Angular CLI not allowing custom webpack loader to run on index.html
Issues.Body:
### Command 
```
- [ X] build
- [ X] serve
```

### Is this a regression?
No. We are migrating from older versions to use Angular 7 cli project for first time

### Description
We have written a custom webpack loader for our requirements which needs to be run on index.html file. To extend webpack configuration, we used below npm module -

https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders

We updated the angular.json file as per documentation of above module.

We were able to successfully use this module to extend webpack config but observed that our loader was run for all html files within project except index.html. Here is our custom webpack config that we used alongside the module -
```js
const path = require('path');
module.exports = {
 module: {
    rules: [{
      test: /\.html/,
      use: [
          '<custom-loader>'
       ]
    }]
 }
```
While debugging, we found that index.html is handled separately using IndexHTMLWebpackPlugin by CLI which we assume might be the cause of this behavior.

**Why we need custom loader?**
We have a large website developed in a federated model and maintained by many teams across different geographic locations. To maintain consistency across all pages for Header/Footer content we have developed it separately as a Preact application. We use this Webpack loader to update index.html with HTML/JS/CSS of our application.

We are using Index.html to inject the code to keep Preact application out of Angular context.

@alan-agius4 I had discussed this with @mgechev during Angular conference last week and he suggested me to file a bug and reach out to you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular CLI not allowing custom webpack loader to run on index.html" (#14392)

Issues.Title: v8 Migration adds browserlist for non-angular apps
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Scope
v8 Browerlist migration

### Is this a regression?

No, this is an enhancement to current behavior

### Description

Currently, the v8 migration produces a `browserlist` file for every `application`. This should be filtered to `application`s which use `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
```
npx -p @nrwl/schematics@latest create-nx-workspace fullstack-ws --preset full-stack --no-interactive
cd fullstack-ws
ng update @angular/cli @angular/core --next --force

## üî• Issue

`apps/api/browserslist` is created which is a backend project which does not need Differential Loading.

## Expected Behavior

`browserlist` should only be created for projects which use `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser` for at least one of their targets.

cc @filipesilva

## üåç Your Environment
Fullstack workspace
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "v8 Migration adds browserlist for non-angular apps" (#14389)

Issues.Title: ~ tilde operator not working as expected (and as it did before)
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... Yes. This used to work in cli 1.7.4 ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... In my SCSS files I have something like this: `@import "~scss/some-style";` This code used to look for styles starting from the src folder and worked just fine. Issues.Title: -Webkit-Line-Clamp Not Working in Angular 6
Issues.Body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ X ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[ ] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior In Angular 5, I was able to use -webkit-line-clamp to limit text to 1 or 2 lines depending on the context. After upgrading to Angular 6, this stopped working. I reverted back to v5 and it worked again. The scss styling I am using is 

    -webkit-line-clamp: 1;
    display: -webkit-box;
    overflow: hidden;
    text-overflow: ellipsis;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
## Expected behavior -webkit-line-clamp should continue to work after upgrading ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions I created a project with Angular CLI for v5, added an element that wraps, then upgraded the project to Angular 6. The git project can be found here: https://github.com/briantq/ng-line-clamp I have two branches, v5 and v6. v5 is Angular 5 and when running 'ng serve' will render correctly. v6 is the upgrade to Angular 6 and when running 'ng serve', will not truncate. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? For list views, we don't want to render full content, instead only a preview. Due to responsive design, we don't know how much text we need to render so rely on line-clamp. Preview renders way too much content and is no longer a manageable. ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.X.X


Browser:
- [ X ] Chrome (desktop) version 66
- [ X ] Chrome (Android) version 66
- [ ] Chrome (iOS) version XX
- [ ] Firefox version XX
- [ ] Safari (desktop) version XX
- [ X ] Safari (iOS) version 11.3
- [ ] IE version XX
- [ ] Edge version XX
 
For Tooling issues:
- Node version: 8.9.4
- Platform:  Windows

Others:
Not that I can think of.  Just make sure to run npm update after switching branches.
Please let me know if I can provide additional information that would be helpful. Thank you!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "-Webkit-Line-Clamp Not Working in Angular 6" (#14393)

Issues.Title: build: add rule to warn for undecorated base classes
Issues.Body:
With Ivy, directives or components no longer properly inherit
a constructor from a parent base class which is undecorated.

See more details here: FW-1238

In order to avoid dependency injection issues with Ivy, a new
custom TSLint rule reports a failure when a directive/component
uses dependency injection in a way that breaks with Ivy.

Related to #15975
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: add rule to warn for undecorated base classes" (#15976)

Issues.Title: refactor: don't depend on @Inject for _MatMenuBase DI
Issues.Body:
In Ivy, undecorated base classes (like _MatMenuBase) don't have the same
behavior as View Engine; specifically, inheriting the constructor from the
base class will not work in the DI system. Even in View Engine this was
often counter-intuitive - only constructors with DI decorators would be
properly inherited in JIT.

This commit updates _MatMenuBase to not rely on this implementation detail
of Angular, and instead moves the injected constructor onto _MatMenu itself.

Fixes #15937
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: don't depend on @Inject for _MatMenuBase DI" (#15975)

Issues.Title: Global option for defaulting button type
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Should be an injectable option config to default button to a particular type, e.g. "button"

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Buttons currently default to type "submit" if not specified. It is very common to want type button by default.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

We use an injectable option config in autocomplete, which is the pattern we want to use for this feature:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/autocomplete/autocomplete.ts#L61
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Global option for defaulting button type" (#15989)

Issues.Title: Using keyboard to select chip breaks mat-chip when using Set.has().
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The `selected` attribute should be able to use the `.has` method on a `Set`.

#### What is the current behavior?
It throws `ERROR TypeError: _co.chips.has is not a function` when using keyboard selection. Although, it works fine when using a click to select the chip.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/mat-chip-selected-with-set-bug

1. Create a `formControl` with a `new Set()` as its initial value.
2. Hook up a `mat-chip-list` and `mat-chip` to the form control
3. In the `selected` attribute pass it the `formControl.value.has`
4. Use keyboard space/enter to try to select a chip    

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular/Material: 7+

#### Is there anything else we should know?
After selecting the chip via the keyboard it breaks mouse selection too.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using keyboard to select chip breaks mat-chip when using Set.has()." (#15980)

Issues.Title: Add spinner to mat-button
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
mat-button clicks often involve an asynchronous operation. Adding a progress spinner or some sort of 'waiting' function makes sense. Disabling the button isn't good enough as it can appear broken to a user.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Sometimes async operations can involve a few seconds or more as the server is doing something. Users need a visual cue that they should be waiting.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add spinner to mat-button" (#15982)

Issues.Title: Make checkbox stroke thicker
Issues.Body: Updates the checkbox-mark-stroke-size to be thicker to match the GM spec more closely. The current divisor makes the width too small (~2.13px for standard 16px checkbox, while it needs to be closer to 4). Tried setting divisor to 8 but that looks too big given the size of the checkbox. A divisor of 10 puts the standard checkmark width at 3.2px for a 16px checkbox which looked balanced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Make checkbox stroke thicker" (#15981)

Issues.Title: Observable completes on router.navigate to change query params
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When using Router.navigate() to navigate to the same route (but to change the query parameters), observables do not complete and retain their observers.

#### What is the current behavior?
When using Router.navigate() to navigate to the same route (but to change the query parameters), observables complete and therefore lose their observers.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-ayqaoe)
1. Open the Stackblitz
2. Open the angular page (you might need to refresh a few times until you see a table instead of a loading spinner)
3. Once you see the table, click on the link at the top, this will use Router.navigate (but to the route you're currently on, it's done just to set the query params)
4. Watch the spinner turn forever because it's no longer subscribed to the WebApiDataSource.loading$ observable.

_**Now change @angular/cdk & @angular/material version to 7.3.0 and try again**_

You will see that it works now. This bug will occur only in Material version 7.3.1 and up. 7.3.0 and below works fine.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
"@angular/core": "7.0.1",
"@angular/material": "^7.3.1",
OSX
"typescript": "~3.1.1",
Chrome, Edge, Opera, Firefox, Safari

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I have tried to look through the changes between 7.3.0 and 7.3.1 but I could not identify a cause. Perhaps someone more experienced with this code can take a better look.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Observable completes on router.navigate to change query params" (#15979)
